lines.text: My God, what's Bond doing?
lines.character: Sir Frederick Gray, Minister of Defence

lines.text: I think he's attempting re-entry, sir.
Mr. Bond, you defy all my attempts to plan an amusing death for you.
James Bond. You appear with the tedious inevitability of an unloved season.
[Bond and Drax are shooting pheasants]
You missed, Mr. Bond.
[a sniper falls from a tree]
Did I?
[Drax addresses his staff aboard the space station]

First there was the dream, now there is reality. Here in the untainted cradle of the heavens will be created a new super race, a race of perfect physical specimens. You have been selected as its progenitors. Like gods, your offspring will return to Earth and shape it in their image. You have all served in public capacties in my terrestrial empire. Your seed, like yourselves, will pay deference to the ultimate dynasty which I alone have created. From their first day on Earth they will be able to look up and know that there is law and order in the heavens.
[after shoving Drax into an air lock and ejecting him into outer space]
Where's Drax?
Oh, he had to fly.
Jaws, you obey me!
[Jaws hesitates]
EXPEL THEM!
You know him?
Not socially. His name's Jaws, he kills people.
Look after Mr. Bond. See that some harm comes to him.
Allow me to introduce you to the airlock chamber. Observe, Mr Bond, your route from this world to the next.
[opens airlock door]
And you, Dr Goodhead, your desire to become America's first woman in space will shortly be fulfilled.
Take a giant step back for mankind.

[while riding in a helicopter]
This is the Drax estate now. Everything you see belongs to Mr. Drax.
He owns a lot, doesn't he?
What he doesn't own, he doesn't want.

[drops Chang off a building and into a piano]
Play it again, Sam.
[his only line in the Bond series]
Well, here's to us.
[his plans in ruin and holding Bond at gunpoint]
At least I shall have the pleasure of putting you out of my misery. Poor, desolate Mr. Bond.

[shoots Drax with hidden wrist-gun]
Heartbroken Mr. Drax!
Oh, I suppose you're right, Holly. We would be better off working together. Détente?
Agreed.
Understanding?
Possibly.
Co-operation?
Maybe.
Trust?
Out of the question.
Jaws, Mr. Bond must be cold after his swim. Place him where he can be assured of warmth.
[Bond dangles from a cable car a thousand feet up]
Hang on, James!
The thought had occurred to me.
James! But, why are you so late?
I fell out of an airplane without a parachute. Who's in there?
Q and the Minister of Defense.
You don't believe me do you?
No. And you should go right in.
Why did you break up the encounter with my pet python?
I discovered it had a crush on me.

Frederick Gray! What a surprise. And in distinguished company, all wearing gas masks. You must excuse me, gentlemen, not being English, I sometimes find your sense of humor rather difficult to follow!
[Bond runs his hands up the Hostess' leg]
Any higher, Mr Bond, my ears will pop.
Have you broken something?
Only my tailor's heart.
[she kisses him]
What was that for?
For saving my life.
Remind me to do it more often!
Standard CIA equipment. And the CIA placed you with Drax, correct?
Very astute of you, James.
Oh, not really. I have friends in low places.
Could this possibly be the moment for us to pool our resources?
It could have its compensations.
[Embrace and kiss]
I still don't know if I trust you.
I don't know if I trust you either. That's what makes it more exciting, doesn't it?
My name is Bond, James Bond. I'm looking for Dr. Goodhead.
You just found her.
Come on, Mr. Bond. A 70-year-old can take 3 G's.
Well, the trouble is there's never a 70-year-old around when you need one.

[explaining operation of dart wrist-gun]
It's activated by nerve impulses from the wrist muscles.
Like this?
[dart pierces a painting on M's wall]
Oh, thank you, 007!
five blue-tipped, with armour-piercing heads; five red-tipped, cyanide coated, causing death in thirty seconds.
Very novel, Q. Must get them in the stores for Christmas. Good day, gentlemen!
Haven't we met somewhere before?
The face is familiar.
[he touches her hand]
As is the manner.
This evening I'm giving my address.
Then can you think of a reason why we can't go for a drink afterwards?
Not immediately. But I'm sure I shall.
[first lines]
How are we doing, Richard?
We should pass over the English coast 15 minutes ahead of time, sir.
Wow! With this load on our back, that's good going.
Just trust the RAF, sir.
[last lines]
James?
I think it may be time to go home.
Take me 'round the world one more time.
Why not?
Where did you learn to fight like that? NASA?
No. Vassar.

[after blowing a hole in the vent with his watch]
Bang on time!
Despite your efforts, my finely wrought dream approaches its fulfillment.
Your dream, whatever sort of nightmare it is, hasn't a chance, Drax.
You think not? We shall see.
Why James, you look like you've just fallen off a mountain.
Funny you should say that, Moneypenny, actually I was in a cable car. It doesn't matter.
Moneypenny, is 007 back from that African job?
He's on his last leg, sir.
[Next scene, close up of Bond rubbing his hand against a stewardess' thigh]
Do you come with the suite?
It depends who's renting it. Vodka martini? Shaken, not stirred.
They have a warehouse on Carioca Avenue.
I'd like to pay it a discreet visit tonight.
Tonight? I think you may find that a little difficult.
Difficult or not, its something we have to do. And meanwhile, how do you kill five hours in Rio - if you don't Samba?
Ah, there you are 007.
Balls, Q?
Bolos, 007.
Even in death, my magnificence is boundless. When this rocket lifts off, I shall be leaving you in your own private crematorium. Mr. Bond, Dr. Goodhead, I bid you - farewell.
U.S. spacecraft on course to intercept us, sir.
Activate laser. Prepare to destroy spacecraft.
Houston calling Dr. Goodhead. Houston calling. Confirm your position.

[flying over Moonraker's expansive production facilities]
Well, I'd heard that Hugo Drax is obsessed with the conquest of space. Now I can believe it.

[looks up and is shocked to see an enormous chalet]
Good Lord!
The Drax residence. Every stone brought from France. Cute, isn't it?
Magnificent. Why didn't he buy the Eiffel Tower as well?
He did, but the French government refused him an export permit.
Bollinger? If it's '69 you were expecting me.
This is where we leave you, Mr Bond.
A little premature isn't it?
[Holly and James are discussing how to destroy the death globes en route to Earth]
Moonraker 5, that's the answer. Drax's shuttle is armed with a laser. We can track those globes and destroy them.
Afternoon tea. May I press you to a cucumber sandwich?
Thank you, no, nothing at all.
[At Vandenburg Air Force Base Colonel Scott is on the hotline with Soviet General Gogol after Drax's space station has suddenly appeared on radars]
Will you please listen, General Gogol! We didn't put it up there.

[amid a snowstorm outside his mansion]
Neither did we, Colonel Scott! So, what do you propose?
We're taking action. We're sending up a spacecraft to investigate.
Very well. But if we do not hear from you within twelve hours we will take action outselves and hold you responsible for the consequences.
We'll be in touch. Sorry to have awoken you.
I was already awake. How can I sleep? Nothing but problems. Problems, problems.
[Gogol hangs up and returns to bed with his lovely secretary]
I never learned to read.
